title: Schapelle Corby celebrates re-release of her autobiography My Story
text:
Schapelle Corby has re-released her bestselling autobiography, My Story.

On Tuesday, the convicted drug trafficker took to Instagram to share photos of herself posing with the tome in hand with friends and family.

In one image, the 42-year-old stands next to her sister Mercedes while waiting to catch a flight to Sydney.

She's back! Schapelle Corby (right) has re-released her bestselling autobiography, My Story. (Pictured holding the book with her sister Mercedes Corby)

The book's co-writer Kathryn Bonella recently shared a lengthy post explaining the new contents in the revised autobiography.

'In this revised and updated book Schapelle goes back to dark times, when she was suicidal and spent nights huddled in the ceiling cavity of her cell,' Kathryn wrote.

'Plus in #schapellecorbymystory she talks about her release in 2014, and life at home in Australia since 2017: love, kids, family and daily flashbacks of her hellish 10 years in #hotelK.'

Read all about it! On Tuesday, the convicted drug trafficker took to Instagram to share photos of herself posing with the tome in hand with friends and family

Schapelle is currently on a publicity tour for the book.

According to TV Blackbox, the 42-year-old is set to sit down for her first TV interview with Channel 10's Studio 10 on Wednesday.

Schapelle was famously arrested at Bali airport in October 2004, after drugs were discovered in her boogie board bag.

'Schapelle goes back to dark times': The book's co-writer Kathryn Bonella recently shared a lengthy post explaining the new contents in the revised autobiography

Despite maintaining the drugs were planted without her knowledge, she spent nine years behind bars in the notorious Kerobokan Prison before being released in 2014.

Since being freed, she's largely kept out of the spotlight except for occasional updates on her Instagram account.

The jailbird has been offered several reality TV gigs, including The Bachelorette, but has turned them down.

'In this revised and updated book Schapelle goes back to dark times, when she was suicidal and spent nights huddled in the ceiling cavity of her cell,' Kathryn wrote
description: Schapelle Corby has re-released her bestselling autobiography, My Story.
